thread.title: Oil Prices Pressured by Rising U.S. Rig Count

author: Christopher Alessi
title: Oil Prices Pressured by Rising U.S. Rig Count
text:
LONDON—Oil prices started the week slightly lower Monday, pressured by a rising U.S. rig count, even as the price of crude continues to hover near record three-year highs.
Brent crude, the global benchmark, was down 0.2% at $69.73 a barrel, on London’s Intercontinental Exchange. On the New York Mercantile Exchange, West Texas Intermediate futures were trading down 0.1%, at $64.24 a barrel.
...
